page.title: 15FARMING IN DRUMNADROCHIT
page.content: There are two big farms on the low ground in the area, both specialise in rearing{beef cattle.}The farms have both autumn and spring calving herds and the calves are sold at the local market in{Inverness}and sent for fattening to{Aberdeenshire}and {Perthshire.}Balmacaan farm grows grass for grazing and cutting as silage for winter feed whilst Drumnadrochit farm has more variety growing{barley, turnips, hay}and {silage}as{fodder}crops. On the high ground the land is divided into{crofts}which are small farms specialising in{sheep.}As the farms are so small the crofter often has a{2nd job}ie. forestry worker, postman, roadman etc. The sheep are brought close to the farm for feeding in winter. The lambs are sold in the {autumn}for fattening further South.
